title: 115_hr2185
content: The Act is titled the "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" and involves determining if foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" requires the President to determine if foreign financial institutions have knowingly facilitated significant transactions for certain individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. The certification described in subsection (a)(2) must be submitted in unclassified form, with the option to include a classified annex. Transactions and financial services are deemed significant based on regulations in section 561.404 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 3. DETERMINATION AND CERTIFICATION OF WHETHER CERTAIN FOREIGN PERSONS HAVE SUPPORTED COVERED PERSONS. The President must determine if foreign persons listed in specific attachments have supported certain individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. The determination must be in unclassified form but may include a classified annex. SEC. 4. COVERED PERSONS. A covered person includes an organization designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State or a foreign person whose property is blocked under specific Executive Orders related to terrorism and weapons of mass destruction proliferation. The curr_chunk discusses various Executive Orders related to the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction and blocking property of certain persons in connection with the national emergency with respect to Syria. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting transactions in connection with the national emergency in Syria. The curr_chunk mentions Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting transactions in connection with grave human rights abuses by the governments of Iran and Syria, including the Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. The curr_chunk refers to a person acting on behalf of, owned or controlled by, a person described in the previous Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting transactions in connection with grave human rights abuses by the governments of Iran and Syria. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, the term "appropriate congressional committees" is defined as per the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996. The term "foreign financial institution" is defined according to title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. The term "foreign person" includes natural persons, entities, and representatives who are not United States persons. Foreign terrorist organization refers to any group designated as such by the Secretary of State. Iranian financial institution is defined in the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions Act. Joint comprehensive plan of action is also mentioned. The term "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action" refers to the agreement made on July 14, 2015, in Vienna by Iran and several other countries, including the US, regarding Iran's nuclear program. The term "United States person" is defined in section 14 of the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996 (Public Law 104-172; 50 U.S.C. 1701 note).
